englishNarrator: Narrated Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "When Khosrau perishes, there will be no (more) Khosrau after him, and when Caesar perishes, there will be no more Caesar after him. By Him in Whose Hands Muhammad's life is, you will spend the treasures of both of them in Allah's Cause."
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

englishNarrator: Narrated Jabir bin Samura رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "When Khosrau perishes, there will be no more Khosrau a after him, and when Caesar perishes, there will be no more Caesar after him," The Prophet (ﷺ) also said, "You will spend the treasures of both of them in Allah's Cause."
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: Musailama-al-Kadhdhab (i.e. the liar) came in the life-time of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) with many of his people (to Medina) and said, "If Muhammad makes me his successor, I will follow him." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went up to him with Thabit bin Qais bin Shams رضی اللہ عنہ ; and Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was carrying a piece of a datepalm leaf in his hand. He stood before Musailama (and his companions) and said, "If you asked me even this piece (of a leaf), I would not give it to you. You cannot avoid the fate you are destined to, by Allah. If you reject Islam, Allah will destroy you. I think that you are most probably the same person whom I have seen in the dream." Abu Huraira told me that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ); said, "While I was sleeping, I saw (in a dream) two gold bracelets round my arm, and that worried me too much. Then I was instructed divinely in my dream, to blow them off and so I blew them off, and they flew away. I interpreted the two bracelets as symbols of two liars who would appear after me. And so one of them was Al-Ansi and the other was Musailama Al-Kadhdhab from Al-Yamama."
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

englishNarrator: Narrated Abu Musa رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "In a dream I saw myself migrating from Mecca to a place having plenty of date trees. I thought that it was Al-Yamama or Hajar, but it came to be Medina i.e. Yathrib. In the same dream I saw myself moving a sword and its blade got broken. It came to symbolize the defeat which the Muslims suffered from, on the Day of Uhud. I moved the sword again, and it became normal as before, and that was the symbol of the victory Allah bestowed upon Muslims and their gathering together. I saw cows in my dream, and by Allah, that was a blessing, and they symbolized the believers on the Day of Uhud. And the blessing was the good Allah bestowed upon us and the reward of true belief which Allah gave us after the day of Badr.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: Once Fatima رضی اللہ عنہا came walking and her gait resembled the gait of the Prophet (ﷺ) . The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Welcome, O my daughter!" Then he made her sit on his right or on his left side, and then he told her a secret and she started weeping. I asked her, "Why are you weeping?" He again told her a secret and she started laughing. I said, "I never saw happiness so near to sadness as I saw today." I asked her what the Prophet (ﷺ) had told her. She said, "I would never disclose the secret of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)." When the Prophet (ﷺ) died, I asked her about it. She replied. "The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Every year Gabriel used to revise the Qur'an with me once only, but this year he has done so twice. I think this portends my death, and you will be the first of my family to follow me.' So I started weeping. Then he said. 'Don't you like to be the chief of all the ladies of Paradise or the chief of the believing women? So I laughed for that."
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) in his fatal illness, called his daughter Fatima رضی اللہ عنہا and told her a secret because of which she started weeping. Then he called her and told her another secret, and she started laughing. When I asked her about that, she replied, The Prophet (ﷺ) told me that he would die in his fatal illness, and so I wept, but then he secretly told me that from amongst his family, I would be the first to join him, and so I laughed."
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: `Umar bin Al-Khattab رضی اللہ عنہما used to treat Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہما very favorably `Abdur Rahman bin `Auf رضی اللہ عنہ said to him. "We also have sons that are equal to him (but you are partial to him.)" `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ said, "It is because of his knowledge." Then `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ asked Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ about the interpretation of the Verse:- 'When come the Help of Allah and the conquest (of Mecca) (110.1) Ibn `Abbas رضی اللہ عنہ said. "It portended the death of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), which Allah had informed him of." `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ said, "I do not know from this Verse but what you know."
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) in his fatal illness came out, wrapped with a sheet, and his head was wrapped with an oiled bandage. He sat on the pulpit, and praising and glorifying Allah, he said, "Now then, people will increase but the Ansar will decrease in number, so much so that they, compared with the people, will be just like the salt in the meals. So, if any of you should take over the authority by which he can either benefit some people or harm some others, he should accept the goodness of their good people (i.e. Ansar) and excuse the faults of their wrong-doers." That was the last gathering which the Prophet (ﷺ) attended.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

englishNarrator: Narrated Abu Bakra رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: Once the Prophet (ﷺ) brought out Al-Hasan رضی اللہ عنہ and took him up the pulpit along with him and said, "This son of mine is a Saiyid (i.e. chief) and I hope that Allah will help him bring about reconciliation between two Muslim groups."
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

englishNarrator: Narrated Anas bin Malik رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) had informed us of the death of Ja`far and Zaid رضی اللہ عنہما before the news of their death reached us, and his eyes were shedding tears.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: (Once) the Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Have you got carpets?" I replied, "Whence can we get carpets?" He said, "But you shall soon have carpets." I used to say to my wife, "Remove your carpets from my sight," but she would say, "Didn't the Prophet (ﷺ) tell you that you would soon have carpets?" So I would give up my request.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

englishNarrator: Narrated `Abdullah bin Mas`ud رضی اللہ عنہما :
hadithEnglish: Sa`d bin Mu`adh رضی اللہ عنہ came to Mecca with the intention of performing `Umra, and stayed at the house of Umaiya bin Khalaf Abi Safwan, for Umaiya himself used to stay at Sa`d's house when he passed by Medina on his way to Sham. Umaiya said to Sa`d, "Will you wait till midday when the people are (at their homes), then you may go and perform the Tawaf round the Ka`ba?" So, while Sa`d was going around the Ka`ba, Abu Jahl came and asked, "Who is that who is performing Tawaf?" Sa`d رضی اللہ عنہ replied, "I am Sa`d رضی اللہ عنہ ." Abu Jahl said, "Are you circumambulating the Ka`ba safely although you have given refuge to Muhammad and his companions?" Sa`d رضی اللہ عنہ said, "Yes," and they started quarreling. Umaiya said to Sa`d رضی اللہ عنہ, "Don't shout at Abi-l-Hakam (i.e. Abu Jahl), for he is chief of the valley (of Mecca)." Sa`d رضی اللہ عنہ then said (to Abu Jahl). 'By Allah, if you prevent me from performing the Tawaf of the Ka`ba, I will spoil your trade with Sham." Umaiya kept on saying to Sa`d رضی اللہ عنہ , "Don't raise your voice." and kept on taking hold of him. Sa`d became furious and said, (to Umaiya), "Be away from me, for I have heard Muhammad saying that he will kill you." Umaiiya said, "Will he kill me?" Sa`d رضی اللہ عنہ said, "Yes,." Umaiya said, "By Allah! When Muhammad says a thing, he never tells a lie." Umaiya went to his wife and said to her, "Do you know what my brother from Yathrib (i.e. Medina) has said to me?" She said, "What has he said?" He said, "He claims that he has heard Muhammad claiming that he will kill me." She said, By Allah! Muhammad never tells a lie." So when the infidels started to proceed for Badr (Battle) and declared war (against the Muslims), his wife said to him, "Don't you remember what your brother from Yathrib told you?" Umaiya decided not to go but Abu Jahl said to him, "You are from the nobles of the valley (of Mecca), so you should accompany us for a day or two." He went with them and thus Allah got him killed.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

englishNarrator: Narrated `Abdullah bin Umer رضی اللہ عنہما :
hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "I saw (in a dream) the people assembled in a gathering, and then Abu Bakr رضی اللہ عنہ got up and drew one or two buckets of water (from a well) but there was weakness in his drawing. May Allah forgive him. Then `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ took the bucket and in his hands it turned into a very large bucket. I had never seen anyone amongst: the people who could draw the water as strongly as `Umar رضی اللہ عنہ till all the people drank their fill and watered their camels that knelt down there. Hadrat Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ told Hammam and the prophet (ﷺ) told Abu Hurairah رضی اللہ عنہ: Abu Bakr drew two buckets.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: I got the news that Gabriel came to the Prophet (ﷺ) while Um Salama رضی اللہ عنہا was present. Gabriel started talking (to the Prophet (ﷺ) and then left. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to Um Salama رضی اللہ عنہ, "(Do you know) who it was?" (or a similar question). She said, "It was Dihya رضی اللہ عنہ (a handsome person amongst the companions of the Prophet (ﷺ) )." Later on Um Salama said, "By Allah! I thought he was none but Dihya رضی اللہ عنہ , till I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) talking about Gabriel in his sermon." (The Sub-narrator asked Abu `Uthman, "From where have you heard this narration?" He replied, "From Usama bin Zaid رضی اللہ عنہ .")
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: The Jews came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and told him that a man and a woman from amongst them had committed illegal sexual intercourse. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to them, "What do you find in the Torah (old Testament) about the legal punishment of Ar-Rajm (stoning)?" They replied, (But) we announce their crime and lash them." `Abdullah bin Salam رضی اللہ عنہ said, "You are telling a lie; Torah contains the order of Rajm." They brought and opened the Torah and one of them solaced his hand on the Verse of Rajm and read the verses preceding and following it. `Abdullah bin Salam رضی اللہ عنہ said to him, "Lift your hand." When he lifted his hand, the Verse of Rajm was written there. They said, "Muhammad has told the truth; the Torah has the Verse of Rajm. The Prophet (ﷺ) then gave the order that both of them should be stoned to death. (`Abdullah bin `Umar رضی اللہ عنہما said, "I saw the man leaning over the woman to shelter her from the stones."
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

englishNarrator: Narrated `Abdullah bin Masud رضی اللہ عنہما :
hadithEnglish: During the lifetime of the Prophet (ﷺ) the moon was split into two parts and on that the Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Bear witness (to thus).
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: The Meccan people requested Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to show them a miracle, and so he showed them the splitting of the moon.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: The moon was split into two parts during the lifetime of the Prophet.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: Once two men from the companions of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) went out of the house of the Prophet (ﷺ) on a very dark night. They were accompanied by two things that resembled two lamps lighting the way in front of them, and when they parted, each of them was accompanied by one of those two things (lamps) till they reached their homes.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

englishNarrator: Narrated Al-Mughira bin Shu`ba رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Some of my followers will remain victorious (and on the right path) till the Last Day comes, and they will still be victorious."
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying, "A group of people amongst my followers will remain obedient to Allah's orders and they will not be harmed by anyone who will not help them or who will oppose them, till Allah's Order (the Last Day) comes upon them while they are still on the right path." Umair, Maalik bin Yukhamir, Hadrat Muadh رضی اللہ عنہ says: And they will be in Egypt. Hadrat Moaviyah says that Maalik claims that he has heard from Hadrat Muadh رضی اللہ عنہ that they are in Egypt.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) gave him one Dinar (unit of currently) to purchase a goat. So, I bought two goats with it. Then I sold one of the goats for one dinaar nd took the goat and dinaar to the prophet ﷺ. So, he ﷺ invoked Allah to bless him in his trade. So, he would get profit even if he would purchase dust. Hadrat Sufyan said that Hasan bin Omarah brought us this Hadith and said that Shabeeb had heard this Hadith from Urwah. Shabeeb had heard this Hadith from Urwah. So, I visited him, Shabeeb said: I haven't heard this Hadith from Urwah but said: I have herd a tribe reporting this Hadith from the prophet ﷺ. But I heard him (Hadrat Urwah) saying that he heard the prophet ﷺ saying: Goodness has been attached to the foreheads of horses up to the day of Resurrection. Shabeeb says that he saw seventy horses in his house. Sufyan says that the goat which had been bought was perhaps for sacrifice.
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "There is always goodness in horses till the Day of Resurrection. "
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "There is always goodness in horses."
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions

englishNarrator: Narrated Abu Huraira رضی اللہ عنہ :
hadithEnglish: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "A horse may be kept for one of three purposes: for a man it may be a source of reward; for another it may be a means of living; and for a third it may be a burden (a source of committing sins). As for the one for whom it is a source of reward, he is the one who keeps his horse for the sake of Jihad in Allah's Cause; he ties it with a long rope on a pasture or in a garden. So whatever its rope allows it to eat, will be regarded as good rewardable deeds (for its owner). And if it breaks off its rope and jumps over one or two hillocks, even its dung will be considered amongst his good deeds. And if it passes by a river and drinks water from it, that will be considered as good deeds for his benefit) even if he has had no intention of watering it. A horse is a shelter for the one who keeps it so that he may earn his living honestly and takes it as a refuge to keep him from following illegal ways (of gaining money), and does not forget the rights of Allah (i.e. paying the Zakat and allowing others to use it for Allah's Sake). But a horse is a burden (and a source of committing sins for him who keeps it out of pride and pretense and with the intention of harming the Muslims." The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked about donkeys. He replied, "Nothing has been revealed to be concerning them except this comprehensive Verse (which covers everything) :--'Then whosoever has done good equal to the weight of an atom (or a small ant), Shall see it (its reward) And whosoever has done evil equal to the weight of an atom (or a small ) ant), Shall see it (Its punishment)." (99.7-8)
chapterEnglish: Virtues and Merits of the Prophet (PBUH) and his Companions
